title: Ancient Foundations & Socratic Dialogue
description: Explore early Greek philosophy, Socratic questioning, and the birth of Western thought.

learningObjectives.description: Recognize key ideas from Pre-Socratics, Socrates, and Plato
assessmentCriteria: Discuss how Plato's Theory of Forms influenced later thought

title: Foundations of Personality: Big Five & Basic Theories
description: Explore the Big Five model, trait theories, and Jordan Peterson's approach to personality.

learningObjectives.description: Identify core personality traits and discuss the role of genetics vs. environment
assessmentCriteria: Describe research on heritability of personality

title: Front-End Basics: HTML, CSS, and Basic JavaScript
description: Establish a solid foundation in front-end web development, referencing Harvard CS50 Web resources.

learningObjectives.description: Build static, responsive websites using semantic HTML, CSS layouts, and simple JavaScript
assessmentCriteria: Create multi-page sites with consistent design

title: Neuroanatomy & Brain Regions
description: Overview of major brain structures, referencing Huberman Lab foundational talks and MIT OpenCourseWare.

learningObjectives.description: Identify main regions of the brain and outline their primary functions
assessmentCriteria: Label cortical lobes, cerebellum, and subcortical structures
Discuss the roles of hippocampus and amygdala
